Looking back at Bawaria dacoity along Tamil Nadu highways
description: Twenty years ago, dacoits struck at a bungalow off a highway near Chennai, and killed one of its occupants, sitting MLA Sudarsanam. They attacked other members of the house brutally and fled with the loot they stole from the house. Investigators later realised that they had committed a rash of robberies in a vast area of operation in Tamil Nadu, stretching the borders of Andhra Pradesh and Karnataka. Two decades later, last week, a court in Chennai convicted three members of the Bawaria gang that was responsible for the daring robberies sentenced them to several life terms in prison

This stint aims to ease him back into action before the T20Is against South Africa, ensuring he's match-fit for next year's T20 World Cup.

The nation seeks international aid, with India already dispatching relief supplies and reaffirming support.

Delays in operationalizing export promotion schemes are further hindering recovery efforts.

Airlines are rushing to complete mandatory software and hardware updates, with IndiGo and Air India already fixing portions of their fleets. The move follows a JetBlue incident linked to the ELAC system, raising global safety concerns.

The journey, from Maharishi Valmiki's depiction of Ram's exile to modern movements and legal battles, finally saw the temple stand as a reclaimed heritage.

title: ‘Miniature-lightning’ detected on Mars: Nasa rover makes rare discovery— new study explains
description: NASA's Perseverance rover has detected 'mini-lightning' on Mars for the first time, capturing faint crackles from dust-driven electrical discharges during storms. These tiny, centimetre-scale sparks, unlike Earth's lightning, were recorded by the rover's microphone, offering compelling evidence of atmospheric electrical activity on the Red Planet. Researchers are eager for further confirmation.

Inside the deal-making power of the F-35: A weapon, a network, a strategic lock-in
description: The F-35 is the United States’ one of the strongest bargaining chip because it is irreplaceable — no rival offers its stealth maturity, network warfare capability or global support infrastructure. Nations that qualify to fly it join the most advanced military ecosystem in existence; those excluded remain outside the intelligence-fusion loop that defines modern air combat.

Watch: Why Sabarimala is facing a crisis this pilgrimage season | The Hindu Explains
description: It has been only a week since Sabarimala opened for the Mandala-Makaravilakku season, but concerns are overshadowing devotion. With eight deaths in eight days, severe crowding, medical delays, and poor planning flagged by the Kerala High Court, this year’s pilgrimage has become a major safety challenge. We take a look at what went wrong and what authorities are doing now.

title: ‘No differences’: What transpired at Siddaramaiah–DKS breakfast meet; key takeaways
description: Karnataka's Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar and Chief Minister Siddaramaiah met to quell speculation of a power-sharing tussle. Both leaders asserted unity, calling reports of a rift "manufactured confusion" and pledging to follow the Congress high command's directives. They emphasized their commitment to local and 2028 elections, vowing to fight the opposition together.

description: A C-130 aircraft carrying essential food items and sanitary supplies reached Colombo’s Bandaranaike International Airport at around 1:30 a.m. and was received by the Indian High Commission officials and Sri Lanka Air Force officers.

description: A few passengers received minor superficial injuries. Police have registered a case and are probing the mechanical failure

title: Delhi: 27-yr-old man shot dead during ‘reconciliation’ meeting; one detained
description: A 27-year-old man, identified as Gagan Aahi, was shot dead in Shahdara on Friday night. Police reported that Aahi, a listed 'Bad Character', was meeting with two suspected shooters for reconciliation when the incident occurred. One suspect has been detained, and a search is underway for the second.

description: The deaths of the three children in one family set off alarm bells in the Health Department, which has set up a medical camp in the village and launched a probe into the cause of the deaths, the officials said.

Intense solar radiation risk? Why Airbus pushed A320 software fix — explained
description: Airbus has issued an urgent global alert for its A320-family aircraft due to a software flaw potentially affected by intense solar radiation. This directive follows a JetBlue incident where a jet unexpectedly pitched downward. India will ground over 350 jets for a quick fix, with global operations facing potential short-term disruptions.

title: 'Pull Jasprit Bumrah out of Tests!': R Ashwin drops bombshell on India’s pace ace
description: Jasprit Bumrah's workload is under scrutiny, with Ravichandran Ashwin and AB de Villiers suggesting he be used sparingly in Test cricket. They advocate for protecting him for white-ball assignments and focusing his Test appearances on high-value away series, highlighting his irreplaceable value and unique physical demands.

Explained: What is the Airbus A320 software issue and why are 6,000 planes grounded
description: Airbus has grounded 6,000 A320 aircraft—half its global fleet—for emergency software fixes after discovering intense solar radiation can corrupt critical flight control systems. The unprecedented recall follows an October incident when a JetBlue flight suddenly nosedived without pilot input, forcing an emergency landing. Airlines worldwide face massive disruptions during peak travel season, with repairs taking hours for most planes but weeks for 1,000 older jets requiring hardware replacements. The incident is being hailed as the largest aircraft recall in history.

title: ‘Billionaire meets world’s first potential trillionaire’: Elon Musk seen in Nikhil Kamath’s podcast teaser; fans ask if it’s AI
Hong Kong fire tragedy: Were authorities alerted long before? Key details
description: Residents' prior warnings about flammable materials used in renovations at Wang Fuk Court were ignored, contributing to a devastating fire that claimed at least 128 lives. The blaze rapidly spread due to the materials and malfunctioning fire alarms, leading to arrests for manslaughter and corruption as Hong Kong mourns and calls for stronger safety oversight.

'Love to see it come back': Intel-Apple likely to team-up after 5 years - Here's why
description: Apple might be partnering with Intel again, but this time for manufacturing its entry-level M-series chips by 2027. While Apple will design the chips, Intel will handle production, potentially for MacBooks and iPads. This move could boost US-based manufacturing and diversify Apple's supply chain beyond TSMC, while also validating Intel's turnaround efforts.  Both companies have reportedly signed NDAs and are progressing with development.

description: The BCCI is planning a meeting with selectors and team management to discuss Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's future, focusing on the 2027 ODI World Cup. Clarity on their roles and performance expectations will be provided, with advice to play more domestic cricket to maintain match fitness and form.

title: Esha Deol on bond with father Dharmendra: ‘He beautifully managed both families, was a large-hearted man’
description: Following Dharmendra's passing, a prayer meet saw industry heavyweights like Shah Rukh Khan and Salman Khan pay their respects.  His daughters, Esha and Ahana, have spoken about his ability to manage both his families with grace.  Hema Malini, in a past interview, emphasized her need for his love over material possessions, highlighting his consistent support.

'Indian batters have become NRIs': Manjrekar drops explosive claim after home series collapse
description: Sanjay Manjrekar highlights India's recent home Test series defeats, attributing them to structural issues rather than form. He argues that Indian batters, after excelling domestically, become like 'NRIs' due to extensive overseas play, returning underprepared for home spin conditions. This lack of recent match-time on spin-friendly pitches leaves them ill-equipped.

Cyclone Ditwah nears TN coast: India on alert as Sri Lanka toll passes 80; IMD issues red alert
description: Cyclonic storm Ditwah, moving slowly, brought rain to south Tamil Nadu and is expected to cause intense showers in northern areas, including Chennai, this weekend. The storm, which caused over 80 deaths in Sri Lanka, is moving parallel to the TN coast, with red and orange alerts issued for heavy rainfall in several districts of Tamil Nadu and Andhra Pradesh.

Kaps cafe shooting: From car dealer dream to befriending terrorist; how Sekhon entered crime world
description: A computer applications graduate, Bandhu Maan Singh Sekhon, traded a promising career for organized crime in Canada. Initially working at a pharmacy, he soon entered the underworld, allegedly involved in extortion and weapon trafficking under the guidance of gangster Harry Chatha.  His criminal activities, including links to terror groups, led to his arrest in Canada.

title: 'White collar' terror module: NIA seizes Rs 18 lakh from Dr Shaheen’s room; probe intensifies
description: National Investigation Agency (NIA) discovered Rs 18 lakh cash in a hostel room at Al-Falah University, linked to Dr. Shaheen Shahid, arrested for the Delhi blast. The money is suspected to fund a 'white-coat terror module' operating from the university. Investigations are underway to trace the funds and identify associates involved in expanding the terror network.

title: High uranium in Delhi groundwater: 15% samples exceed safe limits
description: Delhi's groundwater faces alarming uranium contamination, ranking third nationally with 13-15% of samples exceeding safe limits. This rise from previous years raises public health concerns, especially with co-occurring high nitrate, fluoride, and salinity levels. Environmental groups are demanding greater transparency on water quality data and treatment protocols.

title: ‘Staggering damage’: Thousands of Amazon employees send open letter to CEO; question layoffs
description: Over 1,000 Amazon employees have signed an open letter warning of dire consequences from the company's rapid AI development. They argue Amazon is sacrificing climate goals and its human workforce for AI dominance, citing increased emissions, water consumption for data centers, and job displacement. The workers demand ethical AI practices, including clean energy use and employee involvement in AI decisions.

title: Pune horror: IT firm consultant stabbed during road tiff; cops look for SUV driver, woman
description: A Pune IT consultant was stabbed in the rib after a minor collision between his scooter and an SUV in Kharadi. The SUV driver and a female companion allegedly assaulted the victim following an argument. Police are searching for the duo, with the driver identified and expected to be apprehended soon. The incident occurred Wednesday evening.

title: Grief turns to shock: Indian-origin bride's Canada 'accident' now murder
description: A permanent resident in Canada, Mandeep Kaur Grewal, initially reported to have died in a car accident, was allegedly murdered by her brother-in-law. Gurjot Singh Khaira has been charged with second-degree murder and indignity to human remains. The family remains in shock, unaware of the motive behind the alleged killing.

title: UP: ‘Drunk’ man found stuck inside leopard trap cage in Bahraich
description: A man in Uttar Pradesh, India, was found trapped inside a leopard cage after reportedly entering it while intoxicated. The incident occurred in Bahraich district, where a leopard had recently killed a villager. Forest officials and police conducted a two-hour rescue operation to free the man, who was later released with a warning. Efforts to capture the leopard continue.

title: Bo Bichette contract talks pause amid major risks for Toronto Blue Jays
description: MLB analysts are questioning the Toronto Blue Jays' delay in re-signing star Bo Bichette, especially after the team's significant investment in pitcher Dylan Cease. Concerns over Bichette's injury history, including missing substantial time in the 2024 season, are cited as potential reasons for the team's cautious approach to a long-term contract.

title: NBA rumors: Lakers eye $186M Bucks star as they plan league’s next superteam
description: Whispers are growing louder about the Los Angeles Lakers potentially acquiring Giannis Antetokounmpo.  Reports suggest the franchise is exploring aggressive moves to build a future around Luka Dončić, even considering significant short-term sacrifices.  Complex multi-team trade scenarios are circulating, aiming to reshape multiple NBA rosters and create new championship contenders.

title: Ayesha Curry shares heartfelt note to Stephen days after marriage remarks
description: Ayesha Curry posted a heartwarming message for her husband Stephen Curry's new book, "Shot Ready," amidst recent online backlash. She had previously expressed on a podcast that she didn't initially want marriage or children, leading to fan outrage and accusations of disrespecting her husband.
